Sentencas: Manganese cobalt spinel (Mn1.5Co1.5O4, MCO) coatings are prepared by the air plasma spray (APS) process to examine their efficacy in serving as protective coatings from Cr-poisoning of the cathode side in intermediate temperature-solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: These complex oxides are susceptible to process induced stoichiometric and phase changes which affect their functional performance.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: To critically examine these effects, MCO coatings are produced with deliberate modifications to the spray process parameters to explore relationship among process conditions, microstructure and functional properties.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: The resultant interplay among particle thermal and kinetic energies are captured through process maps, which serve to characterize the parametric effects on properties.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: The results show significant changes to the chemistry and phase composition of the deposited material resulting from preferential evaporation of oxygen.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: Post deposition annealing recovers oxygen in the coatings and allows partial recovery of the spine!
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: phase, which is confirmed through thermo-gravimetric analysis (TGA)/differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), X-ray Diffraction (XRD), and magnetic hysteresis measurements.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: In addition, coatings with high density after sintering show excellent electrical conductivity of 40 S cm(-1) at 800 degrees C while simultaneously providing requisite protection characteristics against Cr-poisoning.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance

Sentencas: This study provides a framework for optimal evaluation of MCO coatings in intermediate temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Plasma sprayed manganese-cobalt spinel coatings: Process sensitivity on phase, electrical and protective performance
